title: PHI encryption must use AES-256-GCM with envelope encryption
description: All PHI at rest must use AES-256-GCM. Envelope encryption via AWS KMS is mandatory. Data keys must be unique per patient record.

title: PHI access logging to dedicated Splunk index
description: All read/write access to PHI must log to the phi-access-audit Splunk index within 5 seconds. Logs must include user ID, patient ID (tokenized), timestamp, and access justification code.

title: Minimum Necessary access enforcement for PHI
description: Applications must implement field-level access control for PHI. Users may only access PHI fields required for their role. Annual access reviews are mandatory.

title: PHI data masking in non-production environments
description: All non-production environments must use irreversibly masked PHI data. Production PHI snapshots are prohibited in dev/staging. Use the ACME Data Masking Service (DMS) for test data generation.

title: Business Associate Agreement tracking system
description: All third-party vendors accessing PHI must have a current BAA on file. The system must prevent PHI sharing with vendors whose BAA status is expired or pending.

title: 72-hour breach notification workflow
description: System must support automated breach detection and trigger notification workflow within 1 hour of detection. HIPAA requires notification within 60 days but ACME policy is 72 hours.

title: Patient consent management for data sharing
description: System must capture and enforce granular patient consent preferences for data sharing. Consent records must be immutable and auditable.

title: Secure messaging for PHI transmission
description: PHI must only be transmitted via the ACME Secure Messaging Gateway. Direct email of PHI is prohibited. All PHI in transit must use TLS 1.3.
